casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Adrian Dwayne MOSLEY, Defendant-Appellant. No. 10-41115

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. June 21, 2011. Michelle Suzanne Englade, Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Beaumont, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Margaret Loraine Schmucker, Austin, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Adrian Dwayne Mosley, Beaumont, TX, pro se. Before JONES, Chief Judge, and STEWART and SOUTHWICK, Circuit Judges. *445PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Adrian Dwayne Mosley has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967), and United States v. Flores, 632 F.3d 229 (5th Cir.2011). Mosley has not filed a response. We have reviewed counsel’s brief and the relevant portions of the record reflected therein. We concur with counsel’s assessment that the appeal presents no nonfrivolous issue for appellate review. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
